wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the AlterLabs project overview section. Explain the AI-powered personalized learning platform for Indian students, its mission to revolutionize education through adaptive learning, and core value proposition. Document the target audience (Indian students preparing for competitive exams like JEE and NEET), key differentiators, and platform capabilities. Include the technology vision, innovation aspects, and educational impact. Provide context about the educational challenges in the Indian market and how AlterLabs addresses them through modern frontend technologies and immersive user experiences.

wiki_catalogs.name: Animated Logo Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AnimatedLogo component. Explain the multi-layered SVG animation system built with Anime.js timeline control. Document the complex animation sequence including hexagon reveal, inner shape scaling, letter animation, and floating orb effects. Detail the timeline configuration with staggered delays, easing functions, and continuous animations. Explain the SVG structure with gradients, filters, and neural network-inspired design elements. Include implementation details for the pulse glow effect, decorative rings rotation, and responsive design considerations. Provide examples of customization options, performance optimization techniques, and integration patterns with the broader UI system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Button Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Button component system. Document all button variants (default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link, glow, glass), size options (default, sm, lg, xl, icon), and styling patterns. Explain the component composition using class-variance-authority (cva), prop interfaces, and forwardRef implementation. Include examples of different button states, hover effects, shadow variations, and glass morphism effects. Document the cn utility function usage for conditional class merging. Provide guidelines for extending button variants, customizing animations, and maintaining design consistency. Address accessibility considerations, focus states, and responsive behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for AlterLabs development setup. Include system requirements (Node.js version, operating system compatibility), step-by-step installation instructions, environment setup, and initial project configuration. Document prerequisite knowledge (React, Next.js, TypeScript basics), development server startup procedures, and verification steps to ensure proper installation. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues, IDE recommendations, and development workflow best practices. Include commands for building, running, and testing the application locally.

wiki_catalogs.name: Particle Background System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the ParticleBackground component. Explain the canvas-based particle physics simulation including position tracking, velocity calculations, and collision detection. Document the mouse interaction system with attraction forces and repulsion mechanics. Detail the performance optimization techniques using requestAnimationFrame and efficient rendering loops. Explain the particle connection logic, opacity management, and dynamic sizing based on viewport. Include implementation details for the physics engine, boundary handling, and responsive behavior across different screen sizes. Provide configuration options for particle count, speed, and visual effects. Address browser compatibility, memory management, and performance monitoring approaches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Card Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Card component system. Document the card's glass morphism effects, backdrop blur implementations, and border styling. Explain the component's layout structure, content organization patterns, and interactive states. Include examples of card variants, hover animations, and shadow effects. Document the integration with Tailwind CSS utilities for transparency and blur effects. Provide guidelines for customizing card appearances, adding content sections, and implementing responsive layouts. Address performance considerations for glass effects and accessibility best practices for card-based interfaces.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for AlterLabs frontend architecture. Describe the Next.js 14 App Router structure, component hierarchy, and design patterns used. Document the component-based architecture with functional components, the role of utility functions, and architectural decisions. Explain the relationship between app/, components/, and lib/ directories. Detail the animation system integration, performance optimization strategies, and responsive design approach. Include system boundaries, data flow patterns, and integration points with external libraries like animejs and Lucide React.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parallax Scrolling Effects
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the ParallaxSection component. Explain the scroll-based animation system with configurable speed settings and smooth transitions. Document the scroll event handling, performance optimization using requestAnimationFrame, and cross-browser compatibility considerations. Detail the implementation of layered backgrounds, depth perception effects, and responsive behavior. Include configuration options for parallax ratios, easing functions, and trigger points. Explain the integration with the overall page layout and navigation system. Provide examples of customizing parallax effects, combining with other animations, and optimizing for mobile devices. Address performance considerations, memory management, and fallback behaviors for users with reduced motion preferences.

wiki_catalogs.name: Animation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AlterLabs animation system. Explain the three core animation components: AnimatedLogo with timeline control, ParticleBackground with physics simulation, and ParallaxSection with scroll effects. Document the Anime.js integration, canvas-based particle rendering, and performance optimization techniques. Include implementation details, configuration options, customization possibilities, and integration patterns. Address animation performance considerations, browser compatibility, and responsive behavior across different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the AlterLabs UI component library. Document the Button and Card components, their variants, styling options, and usage patterns. Explain the component composition patterns, prop interfaces, and customization capabilities. Include examples of different button states, sizes, and visual variants. Document the card component's glass morphism effects, layout options, and interactive states. Provide guidelines for extending components, adding new variants, and maintaining design consistency across the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Design System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AlterLabs design system. Document the Tailwind CSS configuration, custom color palette, typography system, and spacing scale. Explain the glass morphism design language, gradient effects implementation, and responsive design breakpoints. Include guidelines for maintaining design consistency, component theming, and extending the design system. Document CSS custom properties, animation utilities, and design token usage. Provide examples of applying design principles consistently across components and pages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation and User Experience
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the AlterLabs navigation and user experience features. Document the responsive navigation system, mobile-first design approach, smooth scrolling implementation, and interactive elements. Explain the navigation state management, menu behavior, and touch-friendly interactions. Include guidelines for implementing new navigation patterns, optimizing user workflows, and maintaining accessibility standards. Document the integration between navigation and page sections, scroll-based interactions, and responsive breakpoint behaviors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for performance optimization strategies in AlterLabs. Document dynamic import patterns, animation performance best practices, bundle size optimization techniques, and runtime performance monitoring. Explain the implementation of performance-critical features like particle physics rendering and scroll-based animations. Include guidelines for measuring performance, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing optimizations. Document Next.js-specific optimizations, code splitting strategies, and caching mechanisms used throughout the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guidelines
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive development guidelines for AlterLabs project maintenance and contribution. Document code style standards, component development patterns, animation best practices, and testing strategies. Explain the project's architectural principles, naming conventions, and folder structure organization. Include guidelines for extending existing components, adding new features, and maintaining code quality. Document TypeScript usage patterns, utility function development, and integration with the design system. Provide templates and examples for common development tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment and Build Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AlterLabs deployment and build process. Document the Next.js build configuration, environment variables setup, and deployment strategies. Explain the build optimization settings, static generation capabilities, and production deployment options. Include guidelines for CI/CD pipeline setup, environment configuration management, and performance monitoring in production. Document the build artifacts, asset optimization, and deployment troubleshooting procedures. Provide examples for different hosting platforms and deployment scenarios.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# AlterLabs: AI-Powered Personalized Learning Platform

## Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
AlterLabs is an innovative AI-powered personalized learning platform designed specifically for Indian students. The platform leverages advanced artificial intelligence to create customized educational experiences that adapt to individual learning styles, preferences, and academic goals.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Personalized Education**: Deliver adaptive learning paths that evolve with each student's progress
- **Indian Student Focus**: Tailor content specifically for CBSE, ICSE, and state board curricula
- **Competitive Exam Preparation**: Support preparation for JEE, NEET, and other competitive examinations
- **Accessibility**: Make quality education accessible and affordable for students across India
- **Innovation**: Introduce cutting-edge AI technologies to transform traditional learning methods

### Target Audience
- Indian students from primary to higher secondary education
- Students preparing for competitive examinations (JEE, NEET, state-level tests)
- Educational institutions seeking modern learning solutions
- Parents looking for effective home tutoring alternatives

## Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The AlterLabs platform follows a modern React-based architecture built with Next.js 14, implementing a clean separation of concerns across multiple layers:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Next.js App Router] --> B[Layout System]
    B --> C[Page Components]
    C --> D[UI Components]
    C --> E[Animation Components]
    
    D --> F[Button Component]
    D --> G[Card Component]
    
    E --> H[AnimatedLogo]
    E --> I[ParticleBackground]
    E --> J[ParallaxSection]
    
    K[Tailwind CSS] --> L[Theme System]
    L --> M[Custom Utilities]
    L --> N[Animations]
    
    O[Anime.js] --> P[Logo Animations]
    Q[Canvas API] --> R[Particle System]
```

### Design Patterns

The application implements several key design patterns:

1. **Component Composition Pattern**: Modular UI components with clear responsibilities
2. **Dynamic Import Pattern**: Client-side only components for enhanced performance
3. **Animation Timeline Pattern**: Complex multi-stage animations using Anime.js
4. **Parallax Scrolling Pattern**: Immersive scrolling effects with scroll event listeners
5. **Glass Morphism Pattern**: Modern UI design with backdrop blur effects

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Home Page] --> B[Navigation Component]
    A --> C[Hero Section]
    A --> D[Features Section]
    A --> E[How It Works Section]
    A --> F[Student Benefits Section]
    A --> G[Call to Action]
    A --> H[Footer]
    
    C --> I[AnimatedLogo Component]
    C --> J[ParticleBackground Component]
    
    D --> K[Feature Cards]
    D --> L[Button Components]
    
    M[Global Styles] --> N[Dark Theme]
    M --> O[Gradient Effects]
    M --> P[Glass Effects]
    M --> Q[Custom Animations]
```

### Data Flow Diagrams

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant N as Navigation
    participant S as Scroll Handler
    participant A as Animation System
    participant P as Particle System
    
    U->>N: Click Navigation Link
    N->>S: Trigger Scroll Event
    S->>A: Update Animation States
    S->>P: Update Particle Positions
    A->>U: Render Animated Components
    P->>U: Display Particle Effects
```

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Application Layout** (`app/layout.tsx`)
- Defines global metadata and font configuration
- Implements internationalization with Google Fonts Inter
- Sets up SEO optimization with Open Graph support

**Main Page** (`app/page.tsx`)
- Single-page application with multiple scrollable sections
- Implements smooth scrolling navigation system
- Contains responsive mobile menu functionality

### Core Modules

**Animated Logo System** (`components/AnimatedLogo.tsx`)
- Complex SVG animation using Anime.js timeline
- Multi-stage animation sequence with staggered timing
- Floating orb system with continuous rotation effects
- Responsive design with dynamic scaling

**Particle Background** (`components/ParticleBackground.tsx`)
- Canvas-based particle system with physics simulation
- Mouse interaction with subtle attraction forces
- Dynamic connection lines between nearby particles
- Performance-optimized animation loop

**Parallax Section** (`components/ParallaxSection.tsx`)
- Scroll-based parallax effect implementation
- Configurable speed and positioning
- Intersection observer integration for performance

### Configuration Approach

**Tailwind CSS Configuration** (`tailwind.config.ts`)
- Custom color palette with electric cyan primary theme
- Glass morphism effect utilities
- Custom animation keyframes and durations
- Responsive design system with custom breakpoints

**Global Styling** (`app/globals.css`)
- CSS custom properties for theme management
- Advanced gradient and background effects
- Custom animation utilities and keyframes
- Performance-optimized CSS-in-JS approach

### External Dependencies

**Core Dependencies** (`package.json`)
- **React 18.2.0**: Frontend library with concurrent features
- **Next.js 14**: Production-ready React framework
- **Tailwind CSS 3.4.0**: Utility-first CSS framework
- **Anime.js 3.2.2**: JavaScript animation library
- **Lucide React**: SVG icon library

**Development Dependencies**
- TypeScript for type safety
- PostCSS for CSS processing
- Tailwind CSS plugins for enhanced functionality

### Integration Points

**Animation Integration**
- Anime.js integrated with React hooks for lifecycle management
- Canvas API for high-performance particle rendering
- CSS animations for smooth transitions and effects

**Performance Optimization**
- Dynamic imports for client-side only components
- React.lazy loading for non-critical components
- Optimized animation frame handling

### Component Relationship Diagrams

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Home Page] --> B[Navigation]
    A --> C[Hero Section]
    A --> D[Features]
    A --> E[Process]
    A --> F[Students]
    A --> G[CTA]
    A --> H[Footer]
    
    C --> I[AnimatedLogo]
    C --> J[ParticleBackground]
    
    B --> K[Mobile Menu]
    B --> L[Desktop Navigation]
    
    D --> M[Feature Cards]
    D --> N[Buttons]
    
    E --> O[Step Indicators]
    E --> P[Process Cards]
    
    F --> Q[Stats Display]
    F --> R[Visual Elements]
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Personalized Learning Experience**
- Adaptive content delivery based on learning patterns
- Real-time difficulty adjustment
- Custom study path creation
- Progress analytics and prediction

**Indian Education Focus**
- Curriculum alignment with CBSE, ICSE, and state boards
- Competitive exam preparation (JEE, NEET)
- Multi-language support (English and regional languages)
- Affordable pricing model

**Modern UI/UX Features**
- Glass morphism design system
- Smooth animations and transitions
- Responsive design for all devices
- Immersive particle background effects

### Implementation Highlights

**Advanced Animation System** (`components/AnimatedLogo.tsx`)
- Multi-layered SVG animation with timeline control
- Physics-based particle interactions
- Continuous floating and rotation effects
- Performance-optimized animation loops

**Immersive Background System** (`components/ParticleBackground.tsx`)
- Canvas-based particle physics simulation
- Mouse interaction with attraction forces
- Dynamic connection visualization
- Automatic particle density calculation

**Responsive Navigation** (`app/page.tsx`)
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Smooth scrolling navigation
- Dynamic menu states and transitions
- Touch-friendly interaction patterns

### Feature Architecture Diagrams

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Loading
    Loading --> Navigation: Page Load Complete
    Navigation --> HeroSection: Scroll Down
    HeroSection --> Features: Scroll Down
    Features --> Process: Scroll Down
    Process --> Students: Scroll Down
    Students --> CTA: Scroll Down
    CTA --> Footer: Scroll Down
    Footer --> Navigation: Scroll Up
    
    Navigation --> MobileMenu: Mobile View
    MobileMenu --> Navigation: Close Menu
```

**Performance State Flow**
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Initial Load] --> B[Static Assets]
    B --> C[Dynamic Imports]
    C --> D[Client Components]
    D --> E[Animation Init]
    E --> F[Particle System]
    F --> G[Interactive Mode]
    
    H[Scroll Event] --> I[Update Positions]
    I --> J[Calculate Forces]
    J --> K[Render Frame]
    K --> H
```

---

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [layout.tsx](app/layout.tsx)
- [page.tsx](app/page.tsx)
- [AnimatedLogo.tsx](components/AnimatedLogo.tsx)
- [ParticleBackground.tsx](components/ParticleBackground.tsx)
- [ParallaxSection.tsx](components/ParallaxSection.tsx)
- [button.tsx](components/ui/button.tsx)
- [utils.ts](lib/utils.ts)
- [tailwind.config.ts](tailwind.config.ts)
- [globals.css](app/globals.css)
- [next.config.mjs](next.config.mjs)

</blog>
